gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.diagram.gnuplot
Class GnuPlotContext

java.lang.Object
  gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.diagram.gnuplot.GnuPlotContext

public class GnuPlotContext
extends java.lang.Object

A context for gnuplot, i.e. a set of variables and respective values that can be set and unset in a gnuplot command file.

Author:
andreou

Constructor Summary

          Creates an empty GnuPlotContext.

Method Detail

setDefaultStyle

public GnuPlotContext setDefaultStyle(PlotStyle defaultStyle)
Sets the default style for plotting datasets. This will be used if there is no explicitly specified style (through setStyle(int, PlotStyle)) that is non-null and non-empty.

Parameters:
defaultStyle - the style to be used for datasets for which there is no explicitly specified style
Returns:
this
See Also:
getStyle(int)

setStyle

public GnuPlotContext setStyle(int columnIndex,
                               PlotStyle style)
Sets the style to be used for a plotted column data, by its index (starting from 1). If a null or empty style is provided, the style is effectively removed, and henceforth the default style will be used for the column.

Parameters:
columnIndex - the index of the plotted data column for which a style is specified
style - the gnuplot style to use
Returns:
this
See Also:
getStyle(int), setDefaultStyle(PlotStyle)

getStyle

public PlotStyle getStyle(int columnIndex)
Returns a style that should be used in the gnuplot "plot" command, after the description of a columnIndex of data. Default value is PlotStyle.lines().

Parameters:
columnIndex - the index of the plotted data column that the returned description will be used to plot The first columnIndex of data has value 1, the second 2, etc.
Returns:
a string that describes the style to be used for this data columnIndex
See Also:
setStyle(int, PlotStyle), setDefaultStyle(PlotStyle)

clearStyles

public GnuPlotContext clearStyles()
Removes all styles.

Returns:
this
See Also:
setStyle(int, PlotStyle), getStyle(int)

getContext

public java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getContext()

setTickScale

public GnuPlotContext setTickScale(double major,
                                   double minor)
Adds an entry of "ticscale" with value "major, minor". Defaults are major=1 and minor=0.5 respectively. Negative numbers put tics outside the diagram.

Returns:
this
